**Antique Appraisal Services Directory: St. John’s, Newfoundland and Labrador**  

### Overview  
No direct listings for dedicated antique appraisal firms were found within the provided resources for St. John’s*. However, broader national/international firms may service this region through partnerships or remote consultations (*see recommendations below*).  

---

### Notable Firms Offering Regional/Nationwide Services  

#### **Turner Drake & Partners Ltd.**  
- *Specialty*: Commercial property valuation (*not antiques*).  
- *Location*: Office at [address redacted], Toronto + Atlantic Canada branches ([website](https://www.turnerdrake.org)).  
- *Certifications*: UBC DULE/BBRE-trained staff; CompuVal® analytics platform use noted [10].  

#### **Gurr Johns**  
- *Specialty*: High-value art/antique valuations globally ($10B+ annually), including tax planning and insurance [1].  
- *Service Area*: Remote consultations possible via their international network; USPAP-compliant reports [1].  

---

### Recommendations for Local Options (*Not Listed in Sources*)  
1️⃣ Contact **[Newfoundland Antique Dealers Association]** (*if active*) for referrals via provincial directories or auctions.*  
2️⃣ Explore **[Canadian Antique Dealers Association]** members operating regionally.*  

---

### Pricing & Service Notes (**General**)  
- Typical fees range $150–$500/hour depending on expertise level ([ISA standards](https://www.auctionsappraisers.com))[6][7]. Insurance/donation-focused reports often flat-rate ($300–$800)[1][9]. Remote valuations may reduce costs[10].  

--- 

**Final Note:** For urgent needs without local options:
- Use ISA/AAA-certified remote appraisers ([Find an ISA Member](https://www.auctionsappraisers.com))[4][6] specializing in furniture/decorative arts[7][8].
